summary:
The Airbus A380 is the world's biggest passenger airplane. Airbus designed it to compete with the Boeing 747. The project began in 1990 and cost about $10.7 billion. The first flight was in 2005, and it started flying passengers in 2007.

The A380 can carry up to 853 people and fly long distances. It's powered by four engines. Despite its size, it has had an excellent safety record. However, production ended in 2021 due to high development costs and low demand.
title: Airbus A380
